author: Jingleboy14

text: You know, this seriously makes me think Sega and Mitsuda should work on more things. Seriously, this game and especially the soundtrack are awesome and definitely Chrono-esque. Always glad to know he's still got it.
author: SpanishFly120

text: I have to say, I'm pretty much a fan of this game (though my original file got corrupted and had to go from a secondary one a bit back. But yeah, the music's really good (I like how a bunch of DS RPGs have really good soundtracks. I swear the RPGs for it feel old-school and new-school at the same time), and the characters/story has been good so far. Though yeah...you can spam the hell out of the flurries, and a certain team combination is borderline broken, lol.
author: SpanishFly120

author: StakeJade

text: Starts like something out of Dragon Quest until what I like to call the "Mitsuda bass". I had some  fun time with this game, though it has its share of problems. The battle system is easily abused after a couple hours in. I also hate when the music restarts from the beginning after every (frequent) battles. You end up only listening to the first 10-20 seconds of the song over and over again.
author: SupraDarky
